parameters.definition: Monthly budget for carrots and cucumbers
Estimated maximum ratio of cucumbers sold to carrots sold
Minimum number of carrots sold per month
Maximum number of carrots sold per month

description: Each month a store owner can spend at most \param{Budget} on carrots and cucumbers. A carrot costs the store owner \param{CostCarrot} and a cucumber costs the store owner \param{CostCucumber}. Each carrot is sold for a profit of \param{ProfitCarrot} and each cucumber is sold for a profit of \param{ProfitCucumber}. The owner estimates that the number of cucumbers sold is at most \param{RatioCucumbersToCarrots} of the number of carrots sold. He also estimates that at least \param{MinCarrotsSold} carrots but at most \param{MaxCarrotsSold} carrots are sold each month. How many of each, carrots and cucumbers, should be sold in order to maximize the profit?
